means: 实际上，实际证明，通过实验

sentence.Network_en: Before opening the front door he lifted the cases experimentally.
sentence.Network_cn: 在打开前门之前，他试探性地提起了那些箱子。

sentence.Network_en: This system is being tried out experimentally at many universities.
sentence.Network_cn: 该系统正在很多大学试用。

sentence.Network_en: This phenomenon has been observed experimentally.
sentence.Network_cn: 这一现象进行过实验性观察.

entry.def: Something that is experimental is new or uses new ideas or methods, and might be modified later if it is unsuccessful.

example.ex: He tends to write bizarre and highly experimental pieces of music...
example.tran: 他倾向于创作高度试验性而且风格奇异的音乐作品。

entry.tran: 实验的;用于实验的;根据实验的
entry.def: Experimental means using, used in, or resulting from scientific experiments.
An experimental action is done in order to see what it is like, or what effects it has.

example.ex: The British Sports Minister is reported to be ready to argue for an experimental lifting of the ban.
example.tran: 据报道，英国体育大臣准备争取试行取消那条禁令。

sentences.en: We decided to test the theory experimentally.
sentences.cn: 我们决定对这个理论进行实验检验。

sentences.en: This phenomenon has been observed experimentally.
sentences.cn: 这一现象进行过实验性观察。

sentences.en: This machine was introduced experimentally in 1960.
sentences.cn: 这台机器是在1960年被试验性地引进的。
